column58: str
column59: str
column60: str
column62: str
column64: str

column58: テストトーク１
column59: テストトーク2

column58: FATE 受注テスト
column59: FATEを開始しますか？
column62: FATE 開始
column64: FATE 開始しない

column58: FATE 納品テスト
column62: FATE 納品OK
column64: FATE 納品CANCEL

column58: 君！　収穫を手伝ってくれないか！急がないと大切な果実をオポオポに取られてしまうよ！
column59:
収穫を手伝いますか？

<Color(-34022)>※このF.A.T.E.の推奨レベルは<Value>IntegerParameter(1)</Value>です。</Color>
column62: 頼んだよ！
column64: そうかい。じゃあ、ほかの人に頼むよ。

column58: 果実を持ってきてくれたのかい？
column62: ありがとう！
column64: おや、違うのかい。

column58: 果実を集めて持ってきてくれ！
Vile poachers! They seek to hide their trophies so that they might return and collect them once we have gone.
column59: We must stop them at any cost! Please, good <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>sir</If>. Lend us your blade!
column60: Assist in recovering the poached hides?
column62: Good luck, and may the Matron bless you!
column64: Very well. We shall see to this task on our own.

column58: Were you able to recover any of the poached hides?
column62: You have my thanks, adventurer, but there may still be more poachers in the area.
column64: The area is still crawling with poachers. See if you cannot find them before they escape!

column58: Hurry, adventurer! We must recover the hides before the poachers can hide them!
Filthy goblins! I merely stopped to relieve myself behind one of these trees, only to find my wares missing when I returned!
column59: I am but a humble merchant, untrained in the ways of battle. Might I ask of your assistance in reclaiming my livelihood? I shall make it worth your while.
column60: Assist in reclaiming the stolen merchandise?
column62: Show them what it means to cross an Ul'dahn!
column64: I shall remember this act of unkindness, adventurer!

column58: Were my wares unharmed?
column62: Yes, but there was more... Much more. I beg of thee, return to me what is rightfully mine!
column64: Then why are you here talking with me!? Find my crates!

column58: Make haste before the goblins make away with my crates!
That big rock ye have there be takin' up an awful lot o' space in yer bag, like. Might be that I could take it off yer hands.
column59: Give the golem fragment to the prospector?
column62: Aye... This'll do jus' nicely. If ye happen upon any more, I'll be here a-waitin'.
column64: And what do <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> need with that ol' rock anywise?

column58: Ye see how them golem stones is drawn to one another like a crow is to carrion? I reckon it's 'cause the stones is carryin' metal within.
column59: Fetch me a few fragments and I'll prove it!

column58: Yes, this should be more than enough.
My scouts report no more poachers in the area. This will have to do for now. You have my thanks, adventurer.
One... Two... Three... I could have sworn I carried more... Oh, well. That is of no matter. I shall merely increase my prices!
Heh heh. I'll be takin' these fragments back to me cabin now. And don't ye think of followin' me now, either!
I...uh... Excuse me...
column59: I'm supposed to be participating in a group training exercise for Order of the Twin Adder recruits...but my party is short a...few members, and...
column60: Would you mind joining me? It would only be for a few moments.
column64: If there was only a simple and convenient way to search for a party...

column58: If I never see a tree slug again it will be too soon!
column59: The repugnant creatures come down from the sentinels to feed on all the flowers, then retreat to the treetops before we can slice off their slimy heads.
column60: There's only so much a beekeeper can do...but you! A mere slug (or thirty) wouldn't be a match for <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> skill and cunning. What do you say?
column62: Oh, and just in time, as well! Look, here they come!
column64: Without any flowers, how will our bees make any honey...?

column58: Please! You must slay the slugs! Think of the bees!
You! You must do something about that besotted brute! He's out of control!
column59: There's a good reason they call him Spenser of the Bottomless Cup. I don't believe the sot's been sober a day in his life.
column60: And now he's taken a fancy to pounding in the faces of any poor sod who happens to even breathe in his direction...myself included. I beg you, put the pissed tosspot in his place!
column64: Then who ever will save us!?

column58: I don't know how much more of this I can take!
Enter Redbelly Hive?
column59: Pass through the gates?

column58: Our scouts report that goblin merchants have met with a band of poachers at a nearby camp to parley the sale of unlawfully obtained hides.
column59: The talks, however, do not seem to be going well, as the two parties have begun fighting. This provides us with the perfect opportunity to strike two birds with one stone.
column60: Good adventurer. Would you assist my unit in our ambush of the outlaws?
column62: Excellent. Let us hurry to the campsite while there is still chaos.
column64: And so you would sit idly by and allow these malefactors to defile the forest? I will never understand you adventurers...

column58: Let these outlaws know there is no place for them in our forest!
調子にのったキキルンの闇商人どもが偽造品を売り歩いているらしい。（仮）
column59: これ以上被害者を増やさないためにも、やつらが持っている偽造品を回収してきてくれないか？（仮）
column60: 偽造品を回収してきますか？（仮）
column62: よし、頼んだぞ！（仮）
column64: 仕方ない、残念だ。（仮）

column58: やつらから偽造品を回収してきたのか？（仮）
column62: よくやった。また見つけたら持ってきてくれ。（仮）
column64: そうか、見つけたらすぐ持ってきてくれ。（仮）

column58: 闇商人どもが持っている偽造品を回収してきてくれ！（仮）
これだけ回収すれば、しばらくやつらの商売もあがったりだろう。（仮）

冒険者か！？
いいところに！　手を貸してくれ！
column59:
ウチの蜂蜜が「インプ」に目をつけられちまったんだ。
奴ら、蜂蜜を奪うだけじゃなく、蜜を守るミツバチにも
攻撃してきやがる。
column60:
ああ、そろそろ来るぞ……。
頼むよ、ウチの蜂蜜のために、にっくきインプどもを
メッタメタに返り討ちにしてやってくれ！
column61:
引き受けますか？

<Color(-34022)>※このF.A.T.E.の推奨レベルは<Value>IntegerParameter(1)</Value>です。</Color>
column64:
むむむ……。
このままじゃ、蜂蜜が……。

column58: The oranges are all picked and boxed. Now I need only wait for the caravan to come pick them up...
column59: The problem is, the caravan is nowhere in sight, and I can already hear the rats clawing their way out from under the rocks. It won't be long before they've found their way into the crates.
column60: I beg of you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>good lady<Else/>good sir</If>! Would you help me in keeping the rats clear of my oranges until the chocobos arrive?
column64: Another harvest lost, then...

column58: Listen carefully, adventurer. Qiqirn bandits have kidnapped several Highbridge residents and are looking to sell them off to the Amalj'aa for tempering.
column59: Once a person has been tempered, the soul is lost and the body transformed into a empty husk which answers only to the commands of the primal Ifrit.
column60: We must stop this foul dealing and rescue the villagers before they are taken back to the Bowl of Embers.
column64: Then the Brass Blades shall fight alone.

column58: Listen up! A series of live Maelstrom training exercises will begin in less than half a bell.
column59: A batch of fresh recruits will more than likely be making a sorry attempt to defend the checkpoint here against a mock imperial assault.
column60: If you wish, you are welcome to join the recruits. Hells, with you at the fore, the greenbacks just might learn something about teamwork.
column64: Then I must ask you to stand clear. I won't have spectators distracting my men.

column58: Twelve take me! If it ain't a real-live 'venturer! I could use some help, if it's help you're profferin'?
column59: You see, I'm tasked with tillin' the orchards so that the roots of these here trees might breathe better, like. But it seems each an ev'ry step I take is straight into a damned mole hill.
column60: I've already gone an' lamed me left leg, and cannae 'ford to lame me right, so I was thinkin' I could get meself a true 'venturer to whack the bloody moles one good. What do you say?
column62: Me da was right! You can always trust a 'venturer to right the wrongs of this world. But enough of me yappin', now get to whackin'!
column64: Me da was right... You can't trust a 'venturer farther than you can kick one.

column58: Me da said the best place to whack a mole is straight upside his head.
Please, you must help me. I am being hunted by the Amalj'aa, and if they catch me, they <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> kill me.
column59: You see, I was tasked with infiltrating Zanr'ak and stealing their battle plans, but I was caught and taken to the Bowl of Embers for tempering. However, I managed to escape when the carriage transporting me and the other slaves slipped off the road.
column60: Though I have a had somewhat of a head start, it took their battle drakes little time to pick up my scent, and now a party of pursuers is only a matter of malms away. I must get to the aetheryte at Little Ala Mhigo so I might relay my findings to the flame commander, but do not believe I can make it on my own.
column61: Escort the scout to Little Ala Mhigo?
column64: Then you have sentenced me to death...or worse, tempering.

column58: A moment of your time, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>?
column59: The fields are crawling with ocean roselings─horrible creatures that choke out the crops and maim the tillers who tend to them. We hold our own against the seedkin, but it seems for every one we cut down, there are three more to take its place!
column60: We'd be obliged if you could lend us your sword in clearing the fields.
column62: That's right kind of you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>. You see? Here they come now!
column64: Apologies, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>. I reckon you have matters of greater import what need attendin'.

column58: Did I not tell you? Three more for every one slain. If only my crops grew so well!
Why!? Why, I ask you!
column59: Why would galagos want anything to do with my flour!? It's not as if they can bake it into bread or lemoncakes! They can't, can they?
column60: But that doesn't stop them from raiding my granaries day in and day out. If this goes on much longer, I will have nothing to take to market and the moneylenders will come for my only daughter... Please! I beg of you! Help me drive off the beasts!
column62: A thousand thanks! A thousand thousand thanks! If only I could find the words to thank you enou─ Oh! They're here!
column64: Perhaps another will come along who can help...

column58: Bloody cane toads! The scholarlies down at Mealvaan's Gate reckoned they would eat the locusts which overrun the wheat fields each year, and so allowed a crate of the slimy creatures to be released into lower La Noscea.
column59: No only did they not eat the locusts, but they began breedin' quicker 'an rabbits, and before we knew it, the whole damn region was burstin' at the seams with the ugly monsters.
column60: Now, I spend my days catchin' and guttin' the toads at the behest of the same damned scholarlies who started this whole mess. It ain't a bad job, but it sure can be right lonely sometimes. Hey, you wouldn't mind keepin' an man company, would you?
column61: That's a good <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. Now off you go while I stand watch here and make sure no one from the road bother us.
column62: Eh? You thought we was going to do the guttin' together? That's rich!

column58: Bloody cane toads! The scholarlies down at Mealvaan's Gate reckoned they would eat the locusts which overrun the wheat fields each year, and so allowed a crate of the slimy creatures to be released into lower La Noscea.
column59: Now, I spend my days catchin' and guttin' the toads at the behest of the same damned scholarlies who started this whole mess. It ain't a bad job, but it sure can be right lonely sometimes. Hey, you wouldn't mind keepin' an man company, would you?
column60: Spend your day catchin' and guttin'?
column62: That's a good <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. Now off you go while I stand watch here and make sure no one from the road bother us. Eh? You thought we was going to do the guttin' together? That's rich!
column64: Then leave me be. I've toads to gut.

column58:
参ったな……またヤーゾンが集まってきやがった。
やつら、杭打ち機に巣を作ろうとするんだよ。
column59:
こうなると作業になんなくてね。
すまないが、ヤーゾンの駆除を手伝ってくれないか？
column60:
引き受けますか？

<Color(-34022)>※このF.A.T.E.の推奨レベルは<Value>IntegerParameter(1)</Value>です。</Color>
column62:
助かるよ。
やつら、そこの木の辺りに集まってきてる。
杭打ち機に寄り付く前に、倒してくれ！
column64: そうか……。急いで他を当たらないとな。

column58: Cores... Cannot drive the piles without earth sprite cores...
column59: Cores harden the land... Help the piles take hold... Have you any cores?
column60: Gather cores for the hammer workers?
column62: Cores...lying about... Cores...flying about...
column64: Cores...

column58: You there. Did the Consortium send you? No? Well, that is of no matter. You are here now, and now you shall help me. Agreed?
column59: The lawless thugs who squat there in that ramshackle manse have stolen my precious cargo and I require you to retrieve it. Not too daunting a task for someone of your obvious talents, I presume?
column60: Ad the merchant?
column62: Very good, very good. Now make haste. I have tea planned with a noble lady not long from now and it would not do well if I were late.
column64: Perhaps you mistook my order for a choice?

column58: Thal's balls! I don't know whether to slit the throats of them goblins, or them what kicked the buggers out of Ul'dah and into Hammerlea!
column59: Now the thrice-damned runts are running about buggerin' up my supplies for the hammers, and I haven't the means to stop them. Now if I had me an adventurer...
column60: Lend the worker a hand?
column62: Give the little shites no quarter. That'll learn 'em.
column64: Ah, I forgot. It's coin what does the talkin', eh? Well, I have more than enough for the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> what does in them gobbies.

column58: Me da... Et by a 'bon, he were.
column59: Now I wants 'em all dead, like. Wiv' crossy eyes like them as drawed in the picture shows. Da used to take me to the picture shows...before he was et. By a 'bon.
column60: Kill some 'bons?
column62: Don't get et!
column64:
<whimper>
One day, I'll be big enough to kill me own 'bon! Jus' you wait!

column58: An adventurer, are you? Well, you'll have to do.
column59: You see that man over there? The big one. The captain of a shipping vessel out of Radz–at–Han found him stowed away below decks. When the captain moored here at the quay, we brought the brute ashore for questioning...
column60: ...when he up and started assailing my men! And for a man whose been holed up in a dark corner for the past fortnight, he has more energy than you'd believe. We could certainly use a hand in calming him down.
column64: Aye... I shan't judge you for your decision. No <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> in their right mind would want to dance with that <Emphasis>thing</Emphasis>.

column58: Cores...?
column62: Cores...
column64: You bring cores...I bring coin... Simple...

column58: Have you retrieved my crates yet? I have an appointment, you know. One with a noble lady. There will be tea.
column62: Is this all? I could have sworn there were more. Countless more. Yes. Now back into the breach, my good <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>fellow</If>.
column64: What are you waiting for!? The tea! It grows ever colder!

column58: Cores...
I do not have the time for this. Tea and noble ladies await! Didn't I mention this?
You seem the able adventurer. I must cross the desert to Forgotten Springs with these relics unearthed here at the Strike, but cannot well defend myself with my hands full.
column59: You see, the seemingly lifeless desert is actually teeming with creatures who wait under the sand for their victims to hap upon their traps. And then there are the Amalj'aa...
column60: So, what say you? Guide me safely to Forgotten Springs and I shall see to it that you are handsomely rewarded.
column64: Well then. I suppose my clients will have to wait.

column58: I swear, each batch of recruits the Barracudas send me is worse than the last. I've already had to send three home because <Emphasis>they wouldn't stop crying</Emphasis>.
column59: If only I had more <If(PlayerParameter(4))>women<Else/>men</If> like you. Ones with sharp blades, and the wits to match.
column60: I know. How about you show these yellow-bellied greenbacks how a true warrior fights? I'll make it worth your while.
column62: Hah hah hah! You hear that, scrags? Prepare to have your arses handed to you on a silver bleedin' platter. Now fall in!
column64:
<sigh>
I suppose they wouldn't have offer much of a challenge anywise.

column58: Thank the Twelve you came along when you did!
column59: Anselm and Fiebras are at each other's throats again! It's that damned ale wench. Both fancy the lass, and neither is willing to stand aside so that the other may have her...though, truth be told, the wench despises both, and only humors them because it is her job to do so.
column60: The two are good lads...when not in their cups, but I fear that their lust for this girl will end in one of them dead! I have already tried calming them with words, but to no avail. This leaves us with but one solution─steel.
column61: Beat the violence out of the two?
column64: This will not end well... You have sentenced a man to death today. Let that sit well on your conscience.

column58: That woman didn't best me. I merely came unprepared.
column59: I didn't think when I left my bed this morning that some slighted scold with a peiste-sized chip on her shoulder might challenge me to a bloody duel. But I wasn't about to refuse her...not with everyone watching and my reputation on the line. If I ain't one thing, it's craven.
column60: But here I am. Bloodied and bruised while that hells-cat sits over there smirking. What she did ain't proper and I plan on learnin' her a lesson. Just, this time with a wee bit of help. What say you?
column64: You aren't craven, are you?

column58: Hear ye! The Maelstrom is conducting a live training exercise at the De Nevelle Checkpoint. All adventurers are welcome to join.
You look to be well-seasoned <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. Would you care to show this batch of yellow-bellied greenbacks a thing or two about battlecraft?
I beg of you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>good lady<Else/>good sir</If>! Might you help me keep these damnable rats clear of my oranges until the chocobo caravan arrives?
Galagos! Galagos! How am I to deliver my wheat to market when the Grey Fleet is overrun with...with...galagos!?

ヤーゾンめ、ウジャウジャ集まりやがって……。
杭打ち機はくれてやるもんか！
If those cursed goblins lay a hand on me cogs I'll...I'll... Well, I'll think of somethin'!
The orobon are at it again! We cannot let them eat any more of the younger fish, or there'll be naught left for next season's catch!
Me da... Et by a 'bon, he were. Now I wants the fishes all dead, like. Can ye make 'em all dead, like?
Ah, an adventurer. And one with fire in <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> eyes, no less. That fire is just what we need.
column59: Spurred by rumors of a new Amalj'aa commander, I arrived outside the beast tribe encampment only to find that not only had the commander arrived, but that the foul lizards were preparing to march on Ul'dah!
column60: A request for reinforcements has already been sent via linkshell, but it will be several bells before they arrive, and by then it will be too late. No, we must stop the enemy before they advance, and since we are sorely outnumbered, I believe the only path to victory is to lower morale by targeting both their supplies and their leader.
column64: Then I suggest you leave this area immediately, for it will soon be engulfed in chaos.

column58: I was right! Stand in the desert long enough, and an adventurer is bound to come calling. So, can one assume you are looking for employment? I am a naturalist studying the magicked aura emitted from the Sunken Temple of Qarn, and I believe this aura is what powers those stone golems which guard the entrance.
column59: If I can learn to disrupt that aura, I may be able to render all the guardians inactive, opening the ruins for further exploration by scholars such as myself. But to do so, I first require the hearts of those very guardians, so I may study how they operate.
column60: Collect soulstones for the naturalist?
column62: Oh, I knew my plan would work!
column64: You would forsake a man in need? What would the good people of the Adventurers' Guild say to that!?

column58: Inside each stone guardian is a soulstone which animates the lifeless rock. I need these stones so I might learn how to extinguish the flames of life within.
You have brought me something, have you not?
column62: The... The light... It burns so brightly, yet emits no heat. What sort of fell magicks am I witnessing here...? Oh, my apologies. Yes, very good. This specimen will do just fine, but I would turn away a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> who brought me more.
column64: But why!? You are a mere adventurer. You cannot expect to fathom the complex mysteries of the soulstones' inner-workings! You must entrust them to me! To me!

column58: Please, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>ma'am<Else/>sir</If>. My baby brother is hungry, but my mother is to weak too feed him. My father left when I was three summers, and my grandfather died last week in Coperbell Mines. My sister moved away to a rich merchant's house and no longer visits us, and my older brother lies all day in the corner with his Somnus pipe... If you could spare some food...
column59: Even the leaves of a cactuar would suffice...
column60: Help the poor girl?
column62: May the Twelve bless you!
column64: <sob> Back to the inn again, then...

column58: Please! My baby brother will starve without something to eat! Anything will do. Even the leaves of a cactuar!
Did you find any leaves?
column62: Thank you! But please, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>ma'am<Else/>sir</If>. Can I have some more?
column64: But my baby brother...!

column58: You there. Might you be the escort Master Gegeruju promised?
column59: My...ah, client awaits me at Hidden Falls and I grow weary in this heat.
column60: I also believe there might be someone following me─a common-enough nuisance for one in my...ah, line of work.
column64: You're <Emphasis>not</Emphasis> the escort? Then you're lucky I don't charge you for the time we've spent here chatting.

column58: Not a quarter moon passes without some feeble attempt by the local Qiqirn to raid Highbridge and steal the supplies which are ferried in regularly by airship.
column59: This is why we Brass Blades stand constant vigil. It is our duty to ensure that the citizens of the settlement can carry out their tasks without fear of being attacked.

column58: Highbridge has its dangers, what with the Qiqirn and the Amalj'aa always lookin' to claim the span as their own...
column59: But one man's hardship is another's opportunity. I look to make a killin' here, what with all the other merchants huddlin' together in safer locales as Drybone and the Golden Bazaar.
column60: And while they sit there splittin' profits, I'll be linin' me coffers with gold...as long as the Brass Blades keep the peace, that is.

column58: Unlike that chatty peddler o'er yonder, I'm not fool enough to believe a motley crew of hired swords can stop the beast tribes from overrunning the span.
column59: It's only a matter of time before they succeed in spiriting away a few of our children again. Yes, you heard me right. It's not only supplies those damned rats seeks.

column58: Another victory under the captain's belt!
column59: And there are quite a few victories under there. I know. I've seen them.

column58: My unit is not unlike a machine.
column59: Each part interlocking, and running best when well-oiled...if you know what I mean.
column60: If you're looking to join, well, then I'm afraid must disappoint. Another hand on the lever is the last thing I need.

column58: The captain sometimes allows me to operate his lever.
column59: Says I'm a right engineer, he does.

column58: For people arriving in Thanalan from the Black Shroud, Highbridge is the first town they arrive in. For people leaving Thanalan, Highbridge is the last town they will see before entering the dark forest.
column59: Not many places can lay claim to both new beginnings and bitter ends.

column58: Welcome to Highbridge. We are one of only a handful of towns that has its own airship landing.
column59: Thought it appears to have been cut over centuries, the canyon in which the Yugr'am River flows was actually formed by five summers past during the great Calamity. The bridge immediately after to reconnect the Royal Allagan Sunway with the Lumberline leading to Gridania.

column58: I'm sorry, but the airships which frequent Highbridge are reserved for the transport of supplies and the occasional naturalist from the Arzaneth Ossuary come to study the ruins of the Invisible City.
column59: If it is airship passage you seek, might I suggest the landings in Ul'dah or Gridania.

column58: Listen! Can you hear them? The screams rising up from the bottom of the canyon!
column59: The Blades all tell me it's naught but the wind, but I've heard the wailing on nights where nary a leaf shuddered. Soon, they'll believe me. When the army of undead march from the Invisible City and reclaim our realm for their own!

column58: Gone... Everything stolen by those rats.
column59: How could we have allowed this to happen... We shan't let our guard down again. I swear it on my honor!

column58: Lever, lever, lever! Is that all he can think about? People were taken from their families! Livelihoods destroyed!
column59: If the captain weren't just so handsome, I'd leave him this instant!

column58: It appears my well-oiled machine...malfunctioned.
column59: Perhaps the lever requires a tad more jostling. And oil. Much more oil.

column58: Did we lose?
column59: Well, then  I suppose tonight he'll be wanting to recalibrate his lever.

column58: Oh, what ever can I do!? This mead must be delivered to the Sanctum of the Twelve before the rite, or the monsignor will have my ar─ Ah, my head. He'll have my head!
column59: But with all these gnats circling about, attracted to the sweet smell of the honey, I'll never make to the sanctuary in one piece!
column60: Would it be too much trouble to ask you to escort me? I could pay you with part of what the monsignor gave me.
column64: Well, I suppose the sting of a gnat is less excruciating than the punishment waiting me if this mead does not arrive on time...

column58: We dinnae force this life upon a single man. Those what could not resist the call o' the Deep left us lubbers long ago, and I wish 'em aught but the best.
If the Admiral wants to believe that we Salthounds've righted the rudder and straightened the ship by reclaimin' the mill, let the fool.
No coin, no loot. Just a rottin' mill and slugs to break me fast on.
column59: Might be as I should raid me that rat-run tradin' post on yonder.

column58: The cap'n says no rum 'til the mill's runnin' proper, like. Good thing I stills keep me that bottle 'idden by the falls.
Damn the cap'n all the way to the seventh gate and back! This bloody mill is beyond mendin'. It should torn down and used to build another ship!
We Salthounds lost our ship and 'alf the bloody crew when the sky fell five summers past. If it weren't fer the cap'n, I suppose most of us'd still be reavin', but as scrags with other crews.
Ye see the Lala off sittin' by 'er lonesome? That be our trusty cap'n. 'Twas 'er notion we should see this mill up an' runnin'.
column59: Why a mill? I's learned in me years as a pirate there be one thing ye ne'er do, and that be question the cap'n.

column58: I's had me my share o' maids back durin' me reavin' days, which is why I agreed to follow the cap'n up 'ere to this forsaken piss pit.
column59: But lo, do ye sees yerself a single blushin' beauty amongst these 'ere roots an' vines? I's been cozened, I has.

column58: Not a single drop o' blood was shed in the takin' o' the mill. By the time we'd arrived, the place 'ad already been long abandoned. Though, if it hadn't, I reckon the tale might've been different.
Some o' these men still revel in the tales o' their exploits on the five seas. Me? I loathed the Deep. A woman as me could get nary a night's rest, what with the constant croakin' an' rockin'.

I once slit the throat of an island king, took 'is daughters, and burned 'is village. The loot I plundered that day saw me belly filled with rum for a moon. And now, 'ere I am, dancin' in the shrubs. So, if ye thinks I look 'appy, yer blinder than a one-eyed crone.
The crew's been 'ere night on three summers, but we've little to show for it. Every time we make e'en an ilm of 'eadway, some new creature crawls from the forest to come kick our arses back down.
The cap'n keeps tellin' us our day, she'll come. I's naught better to do with me time, so wait, I shall.
Cuttin' a throat is easy, it's the getting' to it that be 'ard. Getting' to a tree is easy, it's the cuttin' it that be 'ard.
This 'ere be Salt'ound land. Scurry off afore we cut off yer limbs and use 'em to prop up our feet, like.
I suppose yer wonderin' why I brought me 'ounds 'ere.
column59: Well, keep wonderin', 'cause I ain't tellin' no meddlin' 'venturer.

column58: Why does Master Gegeruju insist on making me wait?
Perhaps a rose by any other name would smell just as sweet, but then again. it would not cost me as much coin.

Since the Admiral and Mealvaan's Gate began implementing stricter import laws, clever pirates have taken to using goblins to distribute their contraband to the people of La Noscea, so that they may escape the hand of justice.
column59: One such pack of goblins has been discovered here in Skull Valley, and me and my men have been ordered to confiscate the goods and slay all those who fail to cooperate.
column60: We could use the help of a skilled adventurer such as yourself. And do not worry. You <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> be rewarded for your efforts. Your safety, on the other hand, I cannot guarantee. But such is any job, no?

column58: Silence! I would not have you disturb our mission to confiscate the contraband being hoarded by that band of goblins....
column59: Unless, that is, you wish to join.
column60: In that case, you are free to infiltrate the goblin camp and retrieve as many crates as you can lift. The ones being carried by the goblins themselves may require a tad more...coercing.
column62: You have our thanks, adventurer. Bring any crates collected back to me, and I will see they are delivered back to the custom house.
column64: In that case, I must ask that you leave this place at once.

column58: Were you able to retrieve any crates?
column62: Yes, these items are all prohibited under thallasocratic decree. The First Assessor will be most pleased.
column64: Then back into the fray with you! That contraband won't confiscate itself!

column58: I have an urgent request, but only if you are bound for Tidegate.
column59: I must deliver important orders from the Admiral herself to the Maelstrom commander stationed at South Tidegate, but the storm privates assigned to accompany me have yet to arrive. For all I know they could be lying drunk in a gutter somewhere. Or <Emphasis>dead</Emphasis> in a gutter somewhere.
column60: You don't appear to be dead or drunk, so could I ask you to escort me through Quarterstone? I don't believe we will encounter much trouble, but I've been known to be wrong on countless occasions.
column64:
I see. Very well then.
Till sea swallows all.

column58: Lemons! I <Emphasis>hate</Emphasis> lemons! I <Emphasis>despise</Emphasis> lemons! I </Emphasis>loath</Emphasis> lemons!
column59: Look at this ankle! It has swollen to the size of an ogre pumpkin! All because I slipped on that blasted lemon rind!
column60: And now, here I am, mere malms from my destination in Vesper Bay, stuck on the side of the Sunway...because of a <Emphasis>LEMON</Emphasis>! You...wouldn't happen to be heading in that direction, now...would you? I could use a sturdy shoulder to lean upon.
column61: Escort the merchant to Vesper Bay?
column64: I suppose you think all this is amusing. A man attacked by a savage lemon rind. Go on. Laugh it up. Let us hear you now.

column58: Enough cores... But can never have truly enough cores...
Cores...? Can never have too many cores...
column62: Core... This will...serve nicely...
column64: Very well...

column58: Thank you! Now I won't have to go back to the inn and that sour-smelling man on the second floor...
You... You want to give me more?
column62: Oh thank you! My baby brother will be so happy...if my older brother doesn't take the leaves and sell them for more Somnus...
column64: Do you have a baby brother, too?

column58: Yes, I believe everything is in order. I seems will be having tea after all! Oh, what a glorious day!
You mean to tell me, there were still crates in the manse?
column62: By golly, you were right! My mind must have been somewhere else. In Ul'dah. Sipping on tea, I suppose.
column64: Of course not! I have all my crates right here! Silly adventurer.

column58: This should be more than a sufficient amount of soulstones. Why, I could light my bedchamber for mon─ I mean, discover <Emphasis>myriad</Emphasis> secrets! Yes.
I have more than enough soulstones to conduct my research, but I won't turn away those who are willing to bring more.
column62: Excellent! My colleagues will never mock me again!
column64: Well, you know where to find me! (Hopefully the guardians do not.)

column58: I beg of you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>milady<Else/>milord</If>! I'm but a poor collector of shells, looking to feed her family.
column59: But the rainbowlip oysters that I sell for a gil a dozen to the kind Lalafell in Costa del Sol are all being eaten by the dreadful colibri.
column60: The savvy little devils follow me and wait until I have found a shell, then swoop in from behind and snatch it from my basket! Try as I might to retrieve them, the birds are much too quick for me to catch. If someone were to help, I would be eternally in their debt!
column62: Praise the Twelve! I shall wait here for you.
column64: My sons... They won't last much longer on sandfleas and seawater.

column58: The colibri have swallowed all my shells whole! If I cannot retrieve them, my sons will go hungry another night!
Might those be rainbowlip oysters you carry!?
column62: Oh, I cannot thank you enough! Unless you were to bring me more. Then I would thank you again!
column64: If left in the colibri's bellies too long, the shells will lose all their luster and the kind Lalafell in Costa del Sol will refuse to buy them.

column58: Tonight my sons and I dine on the finest dodo beaks and pelican feet!
How goes the search for contraband?
column62: Remarkable. To think that there are respectable people in La Noscea who would purchase this filth... I will personally see the contents destroyed in the custom house furnaces.
column64: We haven't much more time. If you find anything suspicious, deliver it to me posthaste.

column58: The operation is nearly complete.
column59: There are a still a few moments before we pack up these crates and deliver them to the custom house for inspection and incineration. If you happen upon any more contraband in that time, please let us know.
column62: Very good. I shall add these items to the others. Your contribution has been duly noted.

column58: No Qiqirn allowed. No exceptions. You ain't a Qiqirn, are you?
column59: No. If you were, I'd smell it.
column60: Might be you could help me, though. A pack of the rats is fixin' to sneak its way in and steal our wine. How do I know? Because they try just about every godsdamned day.
column64: Forget it, then.
